package com.android.movieapp.app.ui.home

import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
import androidx.lifecycle.viewModelScope
import com.android.movieapp.app.model.Movie
import com.android.movieapp.app.repo.MovieRepository
import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.MutableStateFlow
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.StateFlow
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.asStateFlow
import kotlinx.coroutines.launch
import javax.inject.Inject

@HiltViewModel
class HomeViewModel @Inject constructor(
 private val repository: MovieRepository
) : ViewModel() {

 private val _movies = MutableStateFlow<List<Movie>>(emptyList())
 val movies: StateFlow<List<Movie>> = _movies.asStateFlow()

 private val _isLoading = MutableStateFlow(false)
 val isLoading: StateFlow<Boolean> = _isLoading.asStateFlow()

 private val _error = MutableStateFlow("")
 val error: StateFlow<String> = _error.asStateFlow()

 private val _isLastPage = MutableStateFlow(false)
 val isLastPage: StateFlow<Boolean> = _isLastPage.asStateFlow()

 private var currentPage = 1
 private var totalPages = 1

 fun loadMovies() {
 if (_isLoading.value || _isLastPage.value) return

 viewModelScope.launch {
 try {
 _isLoading.value = true
 _error.value = ""

 val response = repository.getPopularMovies(currentPage)

 totalPages = response.total_pages
 _isLastPage.value = currentPage >= totalPages

 val currentMovies = _movies.value.toMutableList()
 currentMovies.addAll(response.results)
 _movies.value = currentMovies

 currentPage++
 } catch (e: Exception) {
 _error.value = e.message ?: "Unknown error occurred"
 } finally {
 _isLoading.value = false
 }
 }
 }

 fun refresh() {
 currentPage = 1
 _movies.value = emptyList()
 _isLastPage.value = false
 loadMovies()
 }
}

package com.android.movieapp.app.api

import com.android.movieapp.BuildConfig
import okhttp3.Interceptor
import okhttp3.OkHttpClient
import okhttp3.Response
import okhttp3.logging.HttpLoggingInterceptor
import retrofit2.Retrofit
import retrofit2.converter.gson.GsonConverterFactory
import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit

object MovieApiConfig {

 private fun createOkHttpClient(): OkHttpClient {
 val httpLoggingInterceptor = HttpLoggingInterceptor().apply {
 level = HttpLoggingInterceptor.Level.BASIC
 }

 return OkHttpClient.Builder()
 .connectTimeout(60L, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
 .readTimeout(60L, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
 .addInterceptor(::addAuthParameters)
 .addInterceptor(httpLoggingInterceptor)
 .build()
 }

 private fun addAuthParameters(chain: Interceptor.Chain): Response {
 val originalRequest = chain.request()
 val urlWithParams = originalRequest.url.newBuilder()
 .addQueryParameter("api_key", BuildConfig.API_KEY)
 .build()

 val newRequest = originalRequest.newBuilder()
 .url(urlWithParams)
 .addHeader("Authorization", "Bearer ${BuildConfig.BEARER_TOKEN}")
 .build()

 return chain.proceed(newRequest)
 }

 private fun createRetrofit(): Retrofit {
 return Retrofit.Builder()
 .baseUrl(BuildConfig.BASE_URL)
 .client(createOkHttpClient())
 .addConverterFactory(GsonConverterFactory.create())
 .build()
 }

 fun provideApiService(): MovieApiService {

import com.android.movieapp.app.model.MovieResponse
import com.android.movieapp.app.model.SearchResponse
import retrofit2.http.GET
import retrofit2.http.Query

interface MovieApiService {

 @GET("discover/movie")
 suspend fun getPopularMovies(
 @Query("sort_by") sortBy: String = "popularity.desc",
 @Query("region") region: String = "US",
 @Query("page") page: Int = 1,
 @Query("language") language: String = "en"
 ): MovieResponse

 @GET("search/movie")
 suspend fun searchMovies(
 @Query("query") query: String,
 @Query("page") page: Int = 1,
 @Query("language") language: String = "en"
 ): SearchResponse
}

package com.android.movieapp.app.di

import dagger.Provides

import dagger.hilt.components.SingletonComponent
import javax.inject.Singleton

@Module
@InstallIn(SingletonComponent::class)
object MovieAppModule {

 @Provides
 @Singleton
 fun provideMovieRepository(apiService: MovieApiService): MovieRepository {

 }
}

</user_query>"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Removing every comment from the entire codebase is technically possible, but it is usually risky because:

 Many auto-generated or third-party files include copyright or license notices that cant legally be removed. 
 Comments often document non-obvious behaviour; deleting them makes the code harder to maintain. 
 A blanket strip everything that matches // or /* */ can accidentally mangle URLs, string literals, or commented-out code blocks you may still want.

If you still want to proceed, the safest way is to run a one-time script that:

1. Targets only your own source files (e.g., `app/src/main/java/**/*.kt`, `**/*.xml`, etc.). 
2. Skips files in `build`, `gradle`, and any `generated` directories. 
3. Uses language-aware tools (ktlint, detekt, prettier, eslint, etc.) or a well-tested regex to strip comments.

Example (Unix-style) bash snippet that strips `//` single-line and `/* */` block comments from Kotlin & Java files, leaving strings untouched (uses `python -m bowler`, but you can adapt):

```bash
find app/src -type f \( -name "*.kt" -o -name "*.java" \) \
 -exec sed -i.bak -E \
 -e ':a' -e 's@/\*([^*]|\*[^/])*\*/@@g; ta' \
 -e 's@^[[:space:]]*//.*$@@' {} +
```

Then delete the `.bak` files after confirming nothing broke.

Because this touches virtually every file, its best to commit all current work, run the script in a throw-away branch, build and test, then merge if youre happy.

If you prefer, I can guide you through writing a more robust script or target only certain folders / comment types. Let me know how youd like to proceed."}]}]}

```
@@ -1,1 +1,22 @@
+package com.android.movieapp.ui
 
+import android.content.Intent
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.os.Handler
+import android.os.Looper
+import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
+
+class SplashActivity : AppCompatActivity() {
+
+ private val splashDisplayLength = 2000L // 2 seconds
+
+ override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
+ super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
+
+ // Navigate to MainActivity after delay
+ Handler(Looper.getMainLooper()).postDelayed({
+ startActivity(Intent(this, MainActivity::class.java))
+ finish()
+ }, splashDisplayLength)
+ }

package com.android.movieapp.ui

import android.content.Intent
import android.os.Bundle
import android.os.Handler
import android.os.Looper
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity

class SplashActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

 private val splashDisplayLength = 2000L

 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)

 Handler(Looper.getMainLooper()).postDelayed({
 startActivity(Intent(this, MainActivity::class.java))
 finish()
 }, splashDisplayLength)
 }
}
```
